DataElement.preferredName: Person Child-Pugh Classification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Child Pugh Classification Eligibility Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the score based on the Child-Pugh classification, used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation, for a person as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Child-Pugh Classification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the Child-Pugh classification, used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation, for a person as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Child-Pugh Classification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade A of the Child-Pugh Classification system.

Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 80% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.

Concepts.definition: Child-Pugh score indicating one-year survival of 80% in patients with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis.  This score is determined by the study of the following five factors: bilirubin, albumin, international normalized ratio, presence and degree of ascites, and presence and degree of encephalopathy.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/26/2015.
